data.title: Surname Brewer: Meaning Origin Variants
data.meta_description: What does the surname Brewer mean? Where does it come from and what are the variants of Brewer? Which famous people have the surname Brewer?
data.text:
Brewer: What does the surname Brewer mean?

The last name Brewer is of Old English origin and is an occupational surname. Derived from the pre-7th-century Old English term "breowan," which literally translates to "to brew," this surname was traditionally given to individuals who brewed beer and other alcoholic beverages as a profession. Brewing was an important trade in medieval times and early brewers played a key role in their communities, so the Brewer surname became quite common throughout England. It's also possible that some people with this surname may be descendants of these early brewers. Over time, the surname spread to other parts of the world, commonly due to British colonization and immigration. Despite its textual connection to the occupation, not all people with the last name Brewer are professionally associated with brewing.

Order DNA origin analysis

Brewer: Where does the name Brewer come from?

The surname Brewer is of Anglo-Saxon origin and is an occupational surname which derived from the old English word "breowan" which means to brew. It was given to someone who worked as a brewer of beers and ales.

The surname first appeared in early medieval England, and in some cases, it may have been used to denote a brew-house or brewhouse-owner. The first recorded spelling of the family name is dated as far back as 1086 during the reign of King William I and was recorded as Robertus Bruarius in the Domesday Book of Sussex.

Today, it is most common in the United States, England, and Australia. According to Forebears, Brewer is the 840th most common surname in the world and itâ€™s most prevalent in the United States. The United States has the highest number of people with the Brewer surname with an estimated 94,533 Brewers. The surname Brewer is very frequently used in English-speaking countries, but it's also present in dozens of other countries across the globe.

Variations of the surname Brewer

The surname Brewer is of occupational origin, originating from Old English 'breowan' which means 'to brew'. It was used to designate a person who brewed beer or ale.

There are several recorded variants and spellings for the name Brewer, such as Brewster, Brauer, Brauwer, Brewar, Brewere, Brewyere, Brewen, Lebrewer, De Brewer, and Brower. The prefixes like 'Le' and 'De' indicate the French influence, showing a broader geographical spread of the name.

Also, Brew, Brewe and Brewes can be considered as shortened versions of Brewer. Brewster specifically is an interesting variant of Brewer. Originally, it was used to refer to female brewers. Brewster comes from the Old English 'breowestre', which means 'brewster, female brewer'.

Many surnames with very similar spelling and pronunciation might have originated independently, in different languages and regions, and hence may not be true variants of Brewer. For example, the German Brauer or Dutch Brauwer might have similar origins, but it's not certain that they are direct variants of Brewer. It's always possible, however, that the names influenced each other through interaction between English, German and Dutch speakers.

Given that surnames often change over time and are influenced by local language and dialect, there could be even more variants and spellings of the surname Brewer.

Famous people with the name Brewer

Teresa Brewer: An American pop and jazz singer.

Corey Brewer: An American professional basketball player.

Jan Brewer: An American politician and author who served as the 22nd Governor of Arizona.

Teresa Brewer: An American singer who enjoyed significant success in the late 1950s and 1960s.

Gay Brewer: A prominent American professional golfer who won the U.S Masters in 1967.

Ron Brewer: An American former professional basketball player and father to Corey Brewer.

Ken Brewer: A prominent American poet and Professor of English.

John D. Brewer: A sociologist known for his work in peace processes and post-conflict reconstruction.

Michael Brewer: A member of the American folk rock duo 'Brewer & Shipley.'

Philip J. Brewer: An American science fiction and television writer.

Jim Brewer: A former Major League Baseball player.

Dewey Brewer: Professional wrestler known under the names "The Missing Link" and "Maxx Payne".

Bill Brewer: a British philosopher specializing in philosophy of mind and metaphysics.

Billy Brewer: An American football player and coach.

Pattie Brewer: Former model and beauty pageant contestant, known as the Miss USA 1972.
